revision.comment: Undid revision 855011852 by [[Special:Contributions/Coolboygcp|Coolboygcp]] ([[User talk:Coolboygcp|talk]]) per [[WP:BLP|BLP policy]]
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2016}} {{Use American English|date=August 2017}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Chelsea Handler | image = Sec. John King and Chelsea Handler (cropped).jpg | caption = Handler in October 2016 | birth_name = Chelsea Joy Handler | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1975|2|25}} | birth_place = [[Livingston, New Jersey]], U.S. | active = 2001–present | medium = {{flatlist| * Stand-up * television * film * books }} | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Observational comedy]] * [[insult comedy]] * [[blue comedy]] * [[surreal humor]] * [[sketch comedy]] * [[satire]] }} | subject = {{flatlist| * [[Culture of the United States|American culture]] * [[American politics]] * [[current events]] * [[popular culture|pop culture]] * [[public figures]] * [[human interaction]] * [[human behavior]] * [[embarrassment]] * [[social awkwardness]] * [[sex]] }} | website = {{url|chelseahandler.com}} }} '''Chelsea Joy Handler'''<ref>{{cite book|last = Handler|first = Chelsea|title = Are You There, Vodka? It's Me, Chelsea|publisher = Simon Spotlight Entertainment|location = City|year = 2008|isbn = 1-4169-5412-0}}</ref> (born February 25, 1975)<ref name="TV Guide">{{cite web|title=Chelsea Handler: Biography|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/chelsea-handler/bio/198528|work=TV Guide|accessdate=September 13, 2010}}</ref> is an American [[comedian]], actress, writer, television host, and producer. She hosted the late-night talk show ''[[Chelsea Lately]]'' on the [[E!]] network from 2007 to 2014, and released a documentary series, ''[[Chelsea Does]],'' on [[Netflix]] in January 2016.<ref name="variety">{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/chelsea-handler-rips-e-tv-experience-1201436471/|title=Chelsea Handler Rips E!, Says Upcoming Netflix Show Like ‘60 Minutes’ But ‘Faster, Cooler’|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=February 18, 2015|author=Andrew Wallenstein}}</ref> Between 2016 and 2017, Handler hosted the talk show, ''[[Chelsea (TV series)|Chelsea]],'' on Netflix.<ref name="HR17" />
In 2012, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named Handler one of the 100 most influential people in the world on its annual [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] list.<ref name="time.com"/><ref name="Forbes Celebrity 100 List"/>
==Early life== Handler was born in [[Livingston, New Jersey]], the youngest of six children of Rita (''[[née]]'' Stoecker), a homemaker, and Seymour Handler, a used car dealer.<ref name=SeatTimes>{{cite news|url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/television/2003986737_webchelsea.html|title=Chelsea Handler and the responsibility of ridiculing Britney|accessdate=January 3, 2009|author=Len Righi|date=November 1, 2007|publisher=Seattle Times}}</ref><ref>Stated on ''[[Who Do You Think You Are? (U.S. TV series)|Who Do You Think You Are?]]'', August 6, 2012</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/2010/06/22/chelsea-handler-televison-business-entertainment-celeb-100-10-handler.html|title=Blonde Ambition: Chelsea Handler|publisher=Forbes|date=June 28, 2010 |first=Mary Ellen|last=Egan|accessdate=August 27, 2014}}</ref> Her American father is [[Jews|Jewish]]; her German-born mother, who came to the United States in 1958, was a [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Mormon]].<ref name=SeatTimes/><ref name="cjnews06">{{cite news|last=Smason|first=Alan|title=Comely comic reveals laughs in 'Horizontal Life’|publisher=Cleveland Jewish News|date=February 2, 2006|url=http://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/archives/article_a7d32057-6319-5121-9255-e9c274c1a773.html|accessdate=January 25, 2010}}</ref> Her mother was diagnosed with [[breast cancer]] in 1989,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://vineyardgazette.com/obituaries/2006/03/17/rita-handler-was-known-great-love-family|work=Vineyard Gazette|title=Rita Handler Was Known for Great Love of Family|date=March 16, 2006|accessdate=June 17, 2016}}</ref> and battled the disease for over 15 years before dying of it in 2006.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oprah.com/own-oprahs-next-chapter/The-Great-Losses-in-Chelsea-Handlers-Life-Video|work=The Oprah Winfrey Network|title=The Great Losses in Chelsea Handler's Life|accessdate=January 22, 2016}}</ref> Handler was raised in [[Reform Judaism]] and had a [[Bat Mitzvah]] ceremony.<ref name="mvgazette1">[http://www.mvgazette.com/article.php?13765 Rita Handler Was Known for Great Love of Family – 3/17/06 – Vineyard Gazette Online]. Mvgazette.com (March 17, 2006). Retrieved on January, 27 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1635312.php/German-grandmas-Not-so-much-Chelsea-Handler-and-Gwyneth-Paltrow-curse-Mutti German grandmas? Not so much, Chelsea Handler and Gwyneth Paltrow curse Mutti] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110429023543/http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1635312.php/German-grandmas-Not-so-much-Chelsea-Handler-and-Gwyneth-Paltrow-curse-Mutti|date=April 29, 2011}}. Monsters and Critics (April 26, 2011). Retrieved on January, 27 2012.</ref><ref>Antonella Gambotto-Burke [http://www.antonellagambotto.com/NonfictionInterviewChelsea.htm Chelsea Handler]. Interview from The South China Morning Post. Retrieved on January 27, 2012.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2713799/Chelsea-Handler-sports-big-hair-bar-mitzvah-Eighties-throwback-shot.html|title=Chelsea Handler sports big hair at her bar mitzvah in Eighties snap|publisher=|accessdate=January 4, 2017}}</ref> She summered in [[Martha's Vineyard]], where her parents owned a house.<ref name="hamptonsmageverywhere">{{cite news|last1=Lyons|first1=Ben|title=CHELSEA HANDLER: HERE, THERE AND EVERYWHERE|url=https://hamptons-magazine.com/chelsea-handler-is-here-there-and-everywhere|accessdate=December 7, 2017|work=Hamptons Magazine|date=May 27, 2011}}</ref>
Handler has two sisters and three brothers; her eldest brother, Chet, died when he was 21, in a hiking accident in the [[Grand Tetons]] in [[Wyoming]]. She was 9 years old at the time.<ref>Antonella Gambotto-Burke [http://www.antonellagambottoburke.com/FOLIO%20-%202010%20-%2007%20-%2011%20-%20scmp%20-%20interview%20-%20chelsea%20handler%20-%2001.pdf Just keep going] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111005041701/http://www.antonellagambottoburke.com/FOLIO%20-%202010%20-%2007%20-%2011%20-%20scmp%20-%20interview%20-%20chelsea%20handler%20-%2001.pdf|date=October 5, 2011}}. ''Sight&Sound''. July 11, 2010</ref> At age 19, she moved from New Jersey to [[Los Angeles, California]], where she lived in her aunt's home, in [[Bel Air, Los Angeles|Bel Air]],<ref name="vulturechelseadoesearnest">{{cite news|last1=Reilly|first1=Phoebe|title=CHELSEA DOES EARNEST … Sort of.|url=http://www.vulture.com/2016/02/chelsea-handler-chelsea-does-c-v-r.html|accessdate=December 7, 2017|work=Vulture|date=February 2016}}</ref> and pursued acting while working as a [[waitress]] to support herself.<ref>{{cite episode|series=Chelsea Does...|title=Marriage|airdate=January 23, 2016|network=[[Netflix]]}}</ref> At 21, Handler decided to pursue stand-up comedy after telling her story about [[driving under the influence]] to a class of other offenders, who found it funny.<ref name="TV Guide"/>
==Television career== Handler was a member of the all-female cast of [[Oxygen (TV channel)|Oxygen network's]] [[hidden camera]] [[Reality television#Hidden cameras|reality]] television series ''[[Girls Behaving Badly]]'',<ref>"Cast Biographies". ''[[Girls Behaving Badly]]''. Volume 1. Season 1 DVD. Disc 2 Bonus Features. Starlight Video. December 26, 2006.</ref> which aired from 2002 to 2005. Other shows on which Handler has appeared include ''[[Weekends at the D.L.]]'', ''[[The Bernie Mac Show]]'', ''[[My Wife and Kids]]'', and ''[[The Practice]]''. She was a regular commentator on E! and ''[[Scarborough Country]]'', as well as a correspondent on ''[[The Tonight Show]]''. She hosted the first episode of the reality TV show ''[[On the Lot]]'', but quit before the second episode aired, saying later that she left "because I smelled the disaster happening before it did."<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/07197/801962-352.stm|title= Summer Press Tour: Posh Beckham, Chelsea Handler|accessdate= January 3, 2009|date= July 16, 2007|publisher= Pittsburgh Post-Gazette}}</ref> The show, produced by [[Steven Spielberg]] and [[Mark Burnett (executive producer)|Mark Burnett]], was a competition for aspiring filmmakers vying for a chance at stardom. It lasted one season. Handler was replaced by former [[Robin & Company]] entertainment anchor, [[Adrianna Costa]]. [[File:Chelsea Handler adjusted.jpg|thumb|left|Handler at LA ''Direct Magazine''{{'}}s "Remember to Give" Holiday Party in 2007]]
In April 2006, Handler began hosting ''[[The Chelsea Handler Show]]'' on [[E!]], which lasted two seasons. In 2007, Handler performed with [[Comedy Central|Comedy Central's]] Hour Stand-Up Comedy Tour across the United States. Her stand-up comedy has also been televised on [[VH1|VH1's]] ''Love Lounge'', Comedy Central's ''[[Premium Blend]]'', and [[HBO|HBO's]] broadcast of the ''[[Aspen Comedy Festival]]''. She was a guest on ''[[Red Eye w/ Greg Gutfeld]]'' and ''[[The View (U.S. TV series)|The View]]'', and she co-hosted ''The View'' on August 2, 2007, and September 5, 2008. On August 18, 2010, it was announced that Handler would be the host of the [[2010 MTV Video Music Awards|2010 MTV Video Music Awards (VMAs)]]. The announcement was surprising to many, including MTV representatives, who claimed that the final decision was unexpected.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tv.msn.com/the-wrap/handler-hosts-vmas/story/?GT1=28103 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100823051322/http://tv.msn.com/the-wrap/handler-hosts-vmas/story/?GT1=28103 |archivedate=August 23, 2010 |title=Chelsea Handler to host 2010 MTV VMAs – MSN TV News |publisher=Tv.msn.com |date=September 17, 2010 |accessdate=September 21, 2010}}</ref> This made Handler the second woman in the history of the VMAs to be the sole host of the ceremony, behind [[Roseanne Barr]], who hosted in 1994.<ref>{{cite web|author=9/2/10 |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1646050/20100819/story.jhtml |title=Chelsea Handler To Host The 2010 MTV Video Music Awards – Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV |date=August 19, 2010 |accessdate=September 21, 2010}}</ref> The event took place at the Nokia Theatre in Los Angeles on September 12, 2010.
In July 2007, Handler began starring on her own half-hour, late-night comedy series on [[E!]] titled ''[[Chelsea Lately]]''. The show proved to be a hit by averaging more than a half-million viewers since its premiere (much more than the average for a late night cable program) and having clips on YouTube with more than one million views. In a 2008 interview, Handler said, "the worse the guests are, the more pathetic they are, the funnier the show is."<ref name="Jacob Bernstein">{{Cite journal|title=Chelsea Handler, Insult Queen|author=Jacob Bernstein|publisher=W magazine|date=December 1, 2008|url=https://www.wmagazine.com/story/chelsea-handler|accessdate=November 19, 2008}}</ref> ''Chelsea Lately'' was broadcast weekdays on the E! Network in the U.S., Canada, U.K, Australia, Germany, and New Zealand. After more than 1,000 episodes, the final episode of ''Chelsea Lately'' aired on August 26, 2014.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/05/28/chelsea-lately-series-finale-to-air-tuesday-august-26-on-e/268330/|title='Chelsea Lately' Starring Chelsea Handler Officially Cancelled by E!; Series Finale to Air Tuesday, August 26|last=Bibel|first=Sara|work=TV by the Numbers|date=May 28, 2014|accessdate=May 28, 2014}}</ref>
The show had a spinoff, the [[mockumentary]] ''[[After Lately]]'', in which the various cast members, writers, crew, guests and even "hangers-on" of ''Chelsea Lately'' are shown bickering over trivial matters and competing for airtime on the show. They also are shown seeking personal approval from Handler, who appeared in very few scenes of the program, and was always portrayed as having open and utter disdain for everyone beneath her. ''After Lately'' debuted on E! on March 6, 2011. Guest stars included: [[Reese Witherspoon]], [[Jennifer Aniston]], [[Jay Leno]], [[Tori Spelling]], [[Jenny McCarthy]], [[Sharon Osbourne]], [[Dave Grohl]], [[Johnny Knoxville]], and [[Jane Fonda]].<ref>[http://www.eonline.com/on/personalities/bio/chuy.jsp Chuy Bravo – On E! Personalities | E! Online]. De.eonline.com. Retrieved on March 18, 2012.</ref>
In 2007, Handler appeared in the Internet-based program ''[[In the Motherhood]]'' with [[Leah Remini]] and [[Jenny McCarthy]] (since January 2008). On September 8, 2008, it was announced that ABC would be turning ''In The Motherhood'' into a series starring [[Jessica St. Clair]], [[Megan Mullally]], and [[Cheryl Hines]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://inthemotherhood.com/node/185|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090208172112/http://inthemotherhood.com/node/185|archivedate=February 8, 2009|title=About the show |publisher=Inthemotherhood.com |accessdate=September 21, 2010}}</ref>
''[[Are You There, Chelsea?]]'' was an [[NBC]] sitcom based on Handler's 2008 best-selling book ''[[Are You There, Vodka? It's Me, Chelsea]]'', which aired from January 11 to March 28, 2012. On May 11, 2012, the network canceled it after only one season.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/05/11/awake-are-you-there-chelsea-best-friends-forever-and-bent-canceled-by-nbc/133644/ | title='Awake, 'Are You There Chelsea?,' 'Best Friends Forever,' and 'Bent' Canceled by NBC | last=Seidman | first=Robert | date=May 11, 2012 | work=TV by the Numbers | accessdate=May 11, 2012}}</ref> [[Laura Prepon]] played the main character Chelsea Newman, a cocktail waitress while Handler portrayed Chelsea's [[Born-Again Christianity|born-again Christian]] sister Sloane, a married, conservative, new mom who had little in common with her carefree sister. [[Dottie Zicklin]] (of ''[[Dharma & Greg]]'') and [[Julie Larson]] (of ''[[The Drew Carey Show]]'') were creators and executive producers. Handler served as executive producer, along with [[Tom Werner]] (of ''[[That '70s Show]]''), Mike Clements (of ''[[The Life & Times of Tim]]''), and Tom Brunelle (of ''Chelsea Lately'').
In 2016, Handler filmed a [[documentary]] series for [[Netflix]] titled ''[[Chelsea Does]],'' consisting of four episodes on marriage, [[Silicon Valley]], racism, and drugs.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/chelsea-does-tv-review-858206|title='Chelsea Does': TV Review|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date= January 22, 2016|accessdate=January 22, 2016}}</ref> In May 2016, she began presenting her new Netflix [[Netflix Original Programing|original]] [[Television comedy|comedy]] [[talk show]] ''[[Chelsea (TV series)|Chelsea]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2016/03/17/chelsea-handler-new-show-on-netflix/81903844/|title=Chelsea Handler gives deets of her new Netflix show in a letter to herself|author=Erin Jensen|work=USA Today}}</ref> The first season streamed Wednesday, Thursday and Friday each week; season 2 streams every Friday.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/chelsea-handler-netflix-talk-show-title-guests-set-1201732831/|title=Chelsea Handler Announces Title for Netflix Talk Show: 'Chelsea'|author=Elizabeth Wagmeister|work=Variety}}</ref> In February 2015, Handler said she envisioned a show more serious than ''Chelsea Lately:'' "I would like a healthy mix of everything that goes on around the world, mixed with interesting stuff in our country. The well-roundedness of ''[[60 Minutes]]'' but faster, quicker, cooler."<ref name="variety" /> In October 2017, Handler announced that the show will be concluding after its second season, as she wishes to focus on activism.<ref name=HR17>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/chelsea-handlers-netflix-show-canceled-2-seasons-1050194|title=Chelsea Handler's Netflix Show Canceled After 2 Seasons|first=Lesley|last=Goldberg|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=October 18, 2017|accessdate=November 22, 2017}}</ref>
==Writings== Handler has written five books that have made the ''[[New York Times Best Seller List]]'', four of which have reached number one. Her first book, ''[[My Horizontal Life: A Collection of One-Night Stands]]'' (2005), describes the variety of sexual encounters she has experienced throughout her life. Her second book, ''[[Are You There, Vodka? It's Me, Chelsea]]'' (2008), a collection of humorous essays, hit the top of [[The New York Times Non-Fiction Best Sellers of 2008|''The New York Times'' Nonfiction Best Seller List]] on May 11, 2008,<ref>[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9505EFDE103AF932A25756C0A96E9C8B63&scp=4&sq=Are%20You%20There%20Vodka?%20It's%20Me,%20Chelsea&st=cse Best-Sellers Non-Fiction]. New York Times. May 11, 2008,</ref> with a print run of more than 350,000.<ref>[http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-dishbook25-2008jun25,0,4494522.story In search of the next Grisham]. LA Times. Josh Getlin. June 25, 2008.</ref> She went on a nationwide tour to promote her third book, titled ''[[Chelsea Chelsea Bang Bang]]'', which was released on March 9, 2010.<ref name="Stelter">{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/01/18/arts/television/18stel.html?_r=1&scp=1&sq=chelsea%20handler&st=cse|work=The New York Times|title=A New Bigmouth on Late Night|first=Brian|last=Stelter|date=January 18, 2009|accessdate=April 28, 2010}}</ref> ''Chelsea Chelsea Bang Bang'' hit Number 1 on ''The New York Times'' Nonfiction Hardback Bestseller list for March 21, 2010.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2010-03-21/hardcover-nonfiction/list.html | title=Hardcover Nonfiction | publisher=NYTimes.com | accessdate=April 25, 2013}}</ref>
On November 15, 2010, it was announced that Handler's publishers gave her her own publishing [[imprint (trade name)|imprint]], Borderline Amazing/A Chelsea Handler Book. She also signed a three-book deal with the imprint, the first of which is called ''[[Lies That Chelsea Handler Told Me]]'', where her coworkers and family members discuss their experiences with Handler, which was released in May 2011 and also hit the top of the bestseller list.{{citation needed|date=December 2017}}
Handler has her own columns in ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'' and ''[[NOW (UK magazine)|NOW]]'', a UK celebrity magazine. In May 2009, she was the host of the [[20th GLAAD Media Awards|20th Annual]] [[GLAAD Media Awards]] in [[San Francisco]].<ref>[http://www.glaad.org/mediaawards/20/press 20th Annual GLAAD Media Awards – Press Information]. GLAAD. Retrieved on September 20, 2012.</ref> In June 2009, she was named as [[Grand Marshal]] of the 2009 [[Los Angeles Pride]] celebration "for her visible and vocal support of equality".<ref name="constantcontact1"/> In July 2010, during a tour stop in [[Salt Lake City]], Handler took part in the "[[I Am Equal]]" photo documentary project in memory of her mother, Rita, who died from complications of cancer. Along with her photo being added to the documentary and accompanying photo mosaic, she also shared a "Photo Story" with a message that inspires people to take chances in life.<ref name="arbus01">{{cite news|last=Peck-Wagner|first=Medeleine|title=Beauty in Diversity |publisher=Arbus Magazine|date=December 2011|url=http://vpub.boyd-printing.com/publication/?i=92036&p=76|accessdate=December 15, 2011}}</ref> In March 2012, she hosted the Human Rights Campaign Gala in [[Los Angeles]].<ref>[http://hrcladinner.com Human Rights Campaign Los Angeles Dinner Gala]. Hrcladinner.com. Retrieved on September 20, 2012.</ref>
In early 2014, Handler released the book ''Uganda Be Kidding Me'', which was number one on [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' Best Seller list]] for two weeks and in the middle of the year did the standup show ''[[Uganda Be Kidding Me: Live]]'', which was then released on [[Netflix]] in October 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.harristheaterchicago.org/events/2013-2014-season/chelsea-handler|title=Uganda Be Kidding Me: Live Tour|accessdate=November 5, 2014|date=|publisher=[[Harris Theater (Chicago)|Harris Theater]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150104040528/http://www.harristheaterchicago.org/events/2013-2014-season/chelsea-handler|archivedate=January 4, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2014/10/10/uganda-be-kidding-me-netflix-react/|title='Uganda Be Kidding me' react: Chelsea Handler nails Netflix debut|accessdate=November 5, 2014|date=October 10, 2014|author=Todd, Carolyn|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]}}</ref>
==Public image== In 2010, Handler was ranked on the ''[[Forbes]]'' Celebrity 100 at No. 98. In 2012, ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named Handler one of the 100 most influential people in the world on their annual [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] list.<ref name="time.com">Kathy Griffin [http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,2111975_2111976_2112087,00.html The 100 Most Influential People in the World: Chelsea Handler]. Time Magazine. April 18, 2012</ref><ref name="Forbes Celebrity 100 List">[https://www.forbes.com/2010/06/22/lady-gaga-oprah-winfrey-business-entertainment-celeb-100-10_land.html Forbes Celebrity 100 List] Forbes, June 28, 2010</ref>
Handler appeared on one of the two covers for the December 2009 edition of ''[[Playboy (magazine)|Playboy]]''. Inside the magazine, Handler posed for a non-nude pictorial. She was also featured on the cover of ''[[Shape (magazine)|Shape]]'' in April 2010, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' in June 2011, on ''[[Redbook]]''{{'}}s March 2012 issue, and on the cover of the September 2012 issue of ''[[Marie Claire]]''.<ref>Kohen, Yael. (August 14, 2012) [http://www.marieclaire.com/celebrity-lifestyle/chelsea-handler-at-work Chelsea Handler Interview – Chelsea Handler at Work]. Marie Claire. Retrieved on 2012-09-20.</ref><ref>Fox, Maria [http://www.redbookmag.com/fun-contests/celebrity/chelsea-handler-quotes-50-cent-aniston Chelsea Handler Puts it All Out There]. redbookmag.com</ref><ref>Bruce, Leslie (February 6, 2011). [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/chelsea-handlers-split-personality-may-193463 Chelsea Handler's Split Personality; May Be 'Done With This Show']. hollywoodreporter.com</ref>
==Awards and recognition== * In March 2009, Handler received the "Ally for Equality Award" from the [[Human Rights Campaign]], recognizing "the outstanding efforts of those who dedicate time, energy, spirit and whole-hearted commitment to better the lives of [[LGBT]] people".<ref name="constantcontact1">[http://archive.constantcontact.com/fs082/1101544755245/archive/1102587930213.html Chelsea Handler named Grand Marshal at LA PRIDE Parade]. Archive.constantcontact.com. Retrieved on September 20, 2012.</ref> * In April 2009, Handler won the [[Bravo (US TV channel)|Bravo]] A-List Award for "A-List Funny."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tierwriting.com/2010/03/handler-wins-the-2009-bravo-a-list-award/|title=Chelsea Handler wins 2009 A-List Award|accessdate= March 3, 2010|date= March 17, 2010|publisher=Bravo}}</ref> * In June 2009, she was named as [[Grand Marshal]] of the 2009 [[Los Angeles Pride]] celebration "for her visible and vocal support of equality".<ref name="constantcontact1" /> * In July 2012, Handler received the Comedy Person of the Year Award at Montreal’s [[Just For Laughs]] comedy festival.<ref>Vlessing, Etan (May 9, 2012). [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/just-for-laughs-comedy-festival-chelsea-handler-aziz-ansari-muppets-322603 "Just For Laughs Fest Books Chelsea Handler, Aziz Ansari and The Muppets"]. ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''.</ref>
==Personal life== In 2006, Handler began dating [[Ted Harbert]], who oversaw [[E!]] as the former CEO of [[Comcast]].<ref name="too hot">{{cite journal|last=Karpel|first=Ari|url= http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20211732,00.html|title= Too hot to Handler|date=July 11, 2008|work= [[Entertainment Weekly]]|issue=1008}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/16/magazine/16wwln-domains-t.html?ref=magazine|title=Domains: Chelsea Handler|accessdate=December 15, 2007|author=Edward Lewine|date=December 16, 2007|publisher=New York Times}}</ref> On January 25, 2010, Handler confirmed, via her late-night talk show, that she had broken up with Harbert. The same year, a leaked sex tape of Handler was being offered for sale. After news of it became public, Handler said on ''Chelsea Lately'' the tape "was made as a joke" more than 10 years earlier, adding, "I put it on an audition tape for a comedy club, because I'm a comedienne, and I've been showing it at birthday parties for fucking years."<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/10/exclusive-chelsea-handler-sex-tape-sale-stopped | title=Chelsea Handler Sex Tape Sale Stopped | publisher=RadarOnline.com | date=October 18, 2010 | accessdate=June 5, 2012}}</ref> In a 2011 interview in ''[[The New York Times]],'' Handler revealed that she had an abortion when she was 16, saying she had the procedure "because that's what I should have done. Otherwise I would now have a 20-year-old kid. Anyway, those are things that people shouldn't be dishonest about."<ref name="Cathy Horyn">{{Cite journal|title= Comedy With a Side of Disgust|author= Cathy Horyn|work=[[The New York Times]]|date= May 20, 2011| url= https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/22/fashion/comedy-with-a-side-of-disgust.html?_r=3&pagewanted=2}}</ref> In a 2016 interview with ''[[Playboy]]'' magazine, Handler revealed that she had a second abortion when she was 16 in addition to the one she talked about with ''The New York Times''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Kimble|first1=Lindsay|title=Chelsea Handler Reveals She Had 2 Abortions at Age 16 in Playboy Essay|url=http://www.people.com/article/chelsea-handler-abortion-playboy-essay|website=People.com|publisher=People Magazine|accessdate=June 28, 2016}}</ref>
Handler was a vocal supporter of [[United States presidential election, 2016|the 2016 presidential]] candidate [[Hillary Clinton]] and was critical of her opponent [[Donald Trump]]. In 2016, she told ''[[The Daily Beast]]'' that a Trump presidency would be the "end of our civilization."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2016/09/30/chelsea-handler-i-would-never-have-donald-trump-on-my-show.html|title=Chelsea Handler: A Trump Presidency Would Be ‘the End of Our Civilization’|publisher=The Daily Beast|date=September 26, 2016|accessdate=October 18, 2016}}</ref>
Handler lives in [[Bel Air, Los Angeles]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2010/dirt/real-estalker/chelsea-handler-home-for-the-holidays-1201230890/|work=Variety|title=Chelsea Handler: Home For the Holidays|author=David, Mark|date=November 17, 2010 | accessdate=May 22, 2017}}</ref>
